days.title: Hello Crypto World

First Chapter is for Discovery and Learning Stuff, Second chapter is... ummm, it's where mystery starts spreading, anyways, hope you enjoy it !!!

days.title: Father of modern crypto: XOR
days.enigma: XOR has many utilities in current crypto systems that you already know of, go towards this link to try and decrypt the flag
hints: the name of the function could lead you to the format of our key
for each iteration, we do modulo i%2 to choose a position in the string '01', hmmm...
days.reaction: Good Job! You are also learning how to read in Python!! I am proud of you!!

days.title: Power of subtitution

days.title: Ceaser Cipher, The return

days.title: Ceasar and his coffee Army

days.title: Base-n encoding
days.enigma: Follow the link for a brief explanation on how base32, base64 work. After that, follow the instructions to encrypt a message with my personal base16 encryption base

days.title: It's over 9000!
days.specialMess: The title is just a reference, but don't worry, I couldn't reach 9000 times with my PC, hhh
days.enigma: I have encoded a certain secret , You will never manually get my secret, MWAHAHAHA

days.title: What the hash
days.enigma: As skeptical as always am, do you exist or am I just scinzophrenic, hmmm... I can't check with my shared experience, cause I could be insane, so I'll try with Hash, I am gonna send a message M with its signature : MD5(M), you receive this, C: 'INUGKY3LJFTFG5LOONUGS3TFJFZVEZLBNQ======'. what is the signature ?
days.reaction: hmm, still not convinced, hhh ( ain't no way I do deserve someone like this easily, I always need to do more for her)

days.title: Tricky Maths
days.enigma: I have a message M, and Key K=M , I used Vernam 26 Times over the message with the same Key, and I got BMJCAJ, on 27th time, what will be the result ?
hints: there are 26 letters in Alphabets
Vernam does have a weakness when using iterations, cause of modulo
days.reaction: I won't let Vernam spill coffee again on my keyboard, MWAHAHAH

days.title: Bloc technique: CBC
days.specialMess: You can check the link  a photo I shared for you to remember CBC. Today's Enigma should be brief to just let you have fun with some calculations, hhh
days.enigma: Let text message (not hexa) be: 'ABCDEF', and IV=0xCC11, and size of block is 2 bytes, and the encryption block operation used is inverse (binary inverse). Try to find in hexa (exclude 0x from answer) the result of this if we use CBC
days.reaction: We have a genius here, Masha'Allah !!

days.title: Cryptogram
days.enigma: You already know subtitution, but can you decrypt it with only your brain power ? check this link and try solve one, the correct sentence in md5 is the flag
days.reaction: I am sorry if that took you some time to solve it, but YOU DID IT, JCLZLCKZNLKNC

days.title: Mysterious file

days.enigma: A mysterious file has merged upon the seas, try to open it and you lay proceed to find the flag

days.title: Check Signal authentics
days.enigma: I need to check that I am not halucinating from your messages, so let me check if you really sent M=14. with G(X) = X^4 + X^2, calculate R(X) awaited so That I can be sure I am not hallucinating, the result is binary (4 bits)
hints: This is CRC, you just need to find the rest of X^4*M(X) / G(X)
days.reaction: ... NO, HOW DO YOU EXIST SO EASILY IN MY LIFE, XDJXJZNXKZJNXKZJN ( I am really grateful tho, BUT STILL? ZJCLZNLKNXKZNLKZNLXKN )

days.title: Lazy Nerd
days.enigma: Check the link, I built a script that do many encryptions, yet its decryption could be done in a single line, MWAHAHAHA
hints: ROT is kind of weaker than cipher, cause it has a really critical weak point
days.reaction: This problem has many solutions, but most importantly you understood how ROT works ^_^

days.title: AES has entered the chat
days.specialMess: I didn't wanna make you an encryption with DES cause it was bit boring and we haven't studied much to let you try it out theorically
days.enigma: for a single block of 128bits : 'Golden HeartSoul', with a key : 'PurpleSecret Key', Just try to make a single iteration of AES with this, you'll find down this link the steps. Output the flag 16 bytes in Hexa ( no need to include 0x )
days.reaction: That was tough, but in the end you did it!!!!

days.title: Asymetrical king: RSA
days.enigma: Oh No !!! some indian guy just passed my computer and spilled his coffee on my keyboard, now my Phi(n) got leaked : 20. Knowing that N = 33 , e = 17 and c = 5 are public, I hope that leaked information won't ruin finding out my M...
days.reaction: Coffee coffee coffee, COFFEE EVERYWHERE, KHCZKBCZKJBCZKJB

days.title: Defying the hellman
days.enigma: Sun and Moon needed to share a secret key, both parties possess a private favourite number : a = 4 / b = 79. They agreed on meeting on two known stars : g=16 / p=157. Now only them would know what will be their secret key that will be shared between them forever
hints: A = g^a % p / B = g^b %p . A and B shall be shared between all stars
K = A^b % p = B^a % p = g^a*b % p
days.reaction: They will soon meet again and merge with prayer and patience

days.title: Camel is calling
days.enigma: As a second commander under the wing of higher admiral 'CinammonRoll the Pillar of North', we saved our sunshine princess!!! now I need to send our secret localisation number ID to my higher admiral Cinammon, he already brought me A=67 , g=16 , p=157, with my secret b = 79 , I already prepared my crypted message C = 106. *Meanwhile Admiral Cinammon: I just received from my commander the number 106, with my secret a = 67, I will find out where's our princess to launch our rescue team
hints: Ask me in messages cause I don't know how to hint here, hhh
days.reaction: SEND ALL TROOPS TO RESCUE OUR SUNSHINE, 3AAAAAAAAAAAAA

days.title: I thrive to sign !!!
days.enigma: They tell me that each time I send a message I need to generate a random key ? Bruh, this is just so useless to me, I will just encrypt my message with AES with key as first 128 bits of my signature of MD5 , that should be enough, MWAHAHAHA. C='xbCIEy/GE0rp93EkN4KJEYFOhEzmr4GSvmneoJibOIsqWLjyD+uKrVgBbJu6ln2E' , IV = '0123456789123456'. Leaked Data = 'INZHS4DUN5BVIRT3NYZXMM3SL4======'
hints: signature is a hash of the secret message
days.reaction: You're doing so good !!! Masha'Allah !!

hints: 435 is a symmetrical encryption
h3ll0_w0r1d

days.title: Gray trouble
days.enigma: Someone keep sending secrets using simply Xor with a binray alternate key ( repetitive 10101010.... ) but when I decrypt I still find a weird message, not a secret, what is he doing to his message before encrypting it ??? See the link for C and the key K
hints: hmmm, what a weird gray problem
maybe he didn't like the standard binary version of his characters
days.reaction: I wonder if you found out immedietluy or not, hhh, I tried my best to hint you, hehe

days.specialMess: M() = MIRROR() / Ω = ALL / pos(1)..pos(6) = topLeft .. downright
hints: it's all about intuition

days.title: Oscar and his favourite game
days.enigma: We rescued Sunshine!!! The message was well received and decrypted by our higher admiral 'CinammonRoll' and he provided us the best rescue team, but... I am seeing in the far north the worst enemy, Oscar... I heard he can decrypt literally anything, he even decrypted my message I sent to my admiral about our localisation, he has the perfect intel and brute force techniques to do that. I need to send one final message to my chef:'Going East.14.7.174 at dawn 07:14', but how can I send this with Oscar intercepting everything... I heard he's blind tho, and my admiral is not far away, hmmm... maybe I can ask princess to help me send the message using her ray of lights, is there a useful code to be able to comminucate with light with my chef?
hints: Light can do only two things if you comminucate with it: light ON / light OFF
How did the olf folk sailors communicated each other on their ships to their colleagues on coastline
maybe binary language could help us here
days.reaction: after the long journey, Oscar couldn't see our message and sunshine was returned safely to her homeland, GLORY TO SUNSHINE, YATAAAAAAAA

days.title: Word Wide Wood
days.enigma: Forest is way underappreciated than ever, it has many hidden layers of surreal facts and intellegence !!! For example, did you know that Trees in Forest can interconnect and communicate between each other ? This network is enabled thanks to some fungi ( sub synonym to mushrooms ) , try to find the name of this fungi

days.title: natural time tracker
days.specialMess: Trees are one of the most seriously underated creatures, if we just open a little but our eyes, we will realise how lively and beneficial are to our eyes.
days.enigma: Did you know that trees can track real time of daylight ? meaning they would know how long was the day for them, this is useful for them when they need to fall their leaves at autumn to prepare themselves before winter. Name this phenomenon that tracks time
days.reaction: one can just be a little aware to realise how much precise, concise, perfect our universe system, sub7anallah

days.title: the war machine: Enigma
days.specialMess: Ahhh yes, the E word, I wanted to finish this month with the most symbolic and inspiring encryption that both of us had knowledge about it, it was nostalgic and beautiful moment for both of us, hope you enjoy my last autistic story to tell
days.enigma: As a second commander under the wing of higher admiral 'CinammonRoll the Pillar of North', we are in a war against Oscar's Soldiers, we keep intercepting their commander's letters but couldn't crack them at all, till the last one when we got an Intel about some machine configuration : 'Pick the rotors G43TE=== , the reflector is gonna be q%wx} , Based on small scale, ROTate carefully with high degree. The position of rings is our international Inigma day, the position of rotors is -1111.11-1'. I need to find their next attack as quick as possible
days.reaction: I need to announce this alerting attack quickly, the war will finally shift to our side !!!
